p: Catalase and cytochrome enzymes require heme. Catalase is a vital hemoprotein also potentially affected by COVID-19 as its malfunction would be responsible for directly increasing free ROS. When catalase is not present, the conversion of hydrogen peroxide (H 2O 2) to water (H 2O) and O 2 does not occur [ 44]. Cytochromes in the ETC, including cytochrome C, are also hemoproteins potentially affected by COVID-19. The binding of COVID-19 may cause dysfunction of the ETC in cells and may translocate cytochrome C into the cytosol from mitochondria, which induces an apoptosis cascade [ 45].
